overview: This subject is designed to develop assessment skills for beginning specialist mental health nursing practice. Skills from Mental Health Nursing 1 will be incorporated with specialist communication skills. Consumer and family perspectives of needs, health and illness will be integrated in the processes of assessment and the investigation of models of care in multi-disciplinary settings. This specialist knowledge will be applied to nursing assessment and care planning, relevant to the range of high- and low-prevalence diagnostic groupings.
ilo: Apply principles of mental health nursing assessment and care planning to assess consumers, including for substance use and first episode psychosis
Generate formulations in order to plan specialist mental health nursing care
Select and evaluate nursing interventions for mental health service users with high and low prevalence conditions, including acute and primary
Assess risk of suicide, self-harm and occupational violence
Generate mental health nursing decisions and practice that incorporate strengths focus and recovery focus
Relate assessment, formulation and mental health nursing care to sociocultural issues in contemporary society
